ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would indeed recommend Anthropology 552 to other students, because they will come away with a wealth of knowledge and, if they do the required readings and assignments, will be able to put that knowledge into practice.
If you want to be critically challenged, TAKE THIS COURSE! The course load is heavy, but very enjoyable.

This class offers a broad overview of the different approaches and works that are being done in the fields of medical anthropology, history of medicine, and public health. Anyone who wishes to tackle these issues from different perspectives should take the class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Course provided a broad overview of relevant research and theoretical arguments as well as useful discussion about the topics of each text and the methods, an ethics where applicable, of each.
Not only will this course teach me how to frame my research questions in a context specific manner, but also remind me of the range of arguments one needs toconsider when framing a research question.
